subject: Relationships
title: Friendship Jealousy: The Unspoken Emotion
description: A short lesson to help you apply Friendship Jealousy: The Unspoken Emotion.

hook.text: Your best friend posts a photo with someone else and calls them 'my person.' Your stomach drops.

buildup.text: Friendship jealousy is common but rarely discussed. We feel possessive but ashamed of feeling possessive.

discovery.text: Evolutionary psychology says jealousy in all bonds â€” not just romantic ones â€” evolved to protect alliances.

twist.text: Expressing friendship jealousy feels immature. So people suppress it â€” and it quietly erodes the bond.

climax.text: Naming the jealousy defuses it. 'I felt left out' is vulnerable enough to strengthen the friendship, not weaken it.

punchline.text: Friendship jealousy is real and normal. Naming it defuses it.

quiz.question: Why is friendship jealousy rarely discussed?
options: People feel ashamed and suppress it
